creator: Adriana.Danes@objectweb.org
text:
Try to modify the minSpareThreads, maxSpareThreads and maxThreads attributes of
a AJP connector MBean by accessing the JMX server, but do not succeed:

1/ Read the value of one of the above attributes by calling getAttribute() method.
2/ Modify the value by calling setAttribute() method with the new desired value
3/ Read the attribute's value by calling getAttribute() method and find the
initial value (obtained in step 1) and not the desired value.

creator: yoavs@computer.org
text: Adriana, is this also true for 5.5.9/5.5.10?

creator: markt@apache.org
text:
http://localhost:8080/manager/jmxproxy?set=Catalina%3Atype%3DThreadPool%2Cname%3Djk-8009&att=maxSpareThreads&val=49
works for me using the latest 5.5.x code so it looks like this has been fixed.

It is unlikely that the fix, whatever it was - I haven't looked - will get
ported back to 5.0.x since there is little/no development taking place on that
branch
